Adopting Ordinance
ORDINANCE NO. 0-76-48
AN ORDINANCE ADOPTING AND ENACTING A NEW CODE OF ORDINANCES OF THE VILLAGE
OF DEERFIELD, LAKE AND COOK COUNTIES, ILLINOIS; ESTABLISHING THE SAME; PROVIDING
FOR THE REPEAL OF CERTAIN ORDINANCES NOT INCLUDED THEREIN, EXCEPT AS HEREIN
EXPRESSLY PROVIDED; PROVIDING FOR THE MANNER OF AMENDING SUCH CODE OF
ORDINANCES; PROVIDING FOR A PENALTY FOR THE VIOLATION THEREOF; AND PROVIDING
WHEN THIS ORDINANCE SHALL BECOME EFFECTIVE
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE VILLAGE OF
DEERFIELD, LAKE AND COOK COUNTIES, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
SECTION ONE : That this Code, consisting of Chapters 1 through 23, inclusive, and printed and
published in book form, is hereby adopted and enacted as the "Municipal Code of the Village of
Deerfield, Illinois", and shall be treated and considered as a new and original comprehensive Code
which shall supersede all other general and permanent ordinances passed by the President and Board
of Trustees on or before March 25, 1976, except such as by reference thereto are expressly saved from
repeal or continued in force and effect for any purpose.
SECTION TWO : That all ordinances of a general and permanent nature of the Village of Deerfield,
enacted on final passage on or before March 25, 1976, and not in such Code, or recognized and
continued in force by reference therein, are hereby repealed from and after the effective date of such
Code, except as hereinafter provided.
SECTION THREE : That the repeal provided for in Section Two hereof shall not affect any offense or act
committed or done or any penalty or forfeiture incurred or any contract or right established or accruing
before the effective date of such Code; nor shall such repeal affect any of the following Codes or
ordinances which are not contained in such Code and which shall be excluded from inclusion therein
and remain in full force and effect:
Ordinances relating to annexations and boundaries
Franchise ordinances
Contract ordinances and ordinances authorizing the execution of a contract
Ordinances vacating, dedicating, widening, paving, naming or changing the names of streets, alleys,
parks or public ways
Ordinances fixing the grades of streets, curbs and sidewalks
Ordinances relating to the leasing, transfer, acceptance, sale or purchase of real estate or personal
property by or from the Village

https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 2/495
Bond ordinances and ordinances pertaining to Village indebtedness
Ordinances providing or guaranteeing the payment of money
Ordinances relating to special assessment and special taxation proceedings
Appropriation, budget and tax levy ordinances
Ordinances fixing salaries of officers, employees and appointees
Ordinances establishing personnel rules and regulations and all other administrative ordinances or
resolutions of the President and Board of Trustees not in conflict or inconsistent with the provisions of
this Code
Ordinances regarding the establishment of Village tax rates
The Zoning Ordinance and amendments thereto
The Ordinance adopting an official Comprehensive Plan for the Village
The Subdivision Control Ordinance and amendments thereto
The Building Codes and amendments thereto
The Plumbing Code and amendments thereto
The Electrical Code and amendments thereto
The Fire prevention and Life Safety Codes
Ordinances pertaining to the condemnation and the disconnection of property
Ordinances concerning the investment of surplus funds or designating a depository for Village funds
Ordinances pertaining to the authorization of motor fuel tax, and Federal revenue sharing
expenditures and improvements
Ordinances accepting any plan or subdivision in the Village or approving any planned unit
development
Ordinances pertaining to the regulation of Burglar and Holdup Alarm Businesses, Systems and Uses
SECTION FOUR : That any and all additions or amendments to such Code, when passed in such form
as to indicate the intention of the President and Board of Trustees to make the same a part thereof, shall
be deemed to be incorporated in such Code so that reference to the "Municipal Code of the Village of
Deerfield, Illinois", shall be understood and intended to include such additions and amendments.
SECTION FIVE : That a copy of such Code shall be kept on file in the office of the Village Clerk,
preserved in looseleaf form. It shall be the express duty of the Village Clerk, or someone authorized by
her, to insert in their designated places all amendments or ordinances which indicate the intention of the
President and Board of Trustees to make the same a part of such Code when the same have been
printed or reprinted in page form, and to extract from such Code all provisions which may from time to
time be repealed by the President and Board of Trustees. This copy of such Code shall be available for
all persons desiring to examine the same and shall be considered the official Municipal Code of the
Village of Deerfield, Illinois.
6/5/2019 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 3/495
SECTION SIX : Whenever in such Code any act is prohibited or is made or declared to be unlawful or a
misdemeanor or a violation of such Code, or whenever in such Code the doing of any act is required or
the failure to do any act is declared to be unlawful or a misdemeanor or a violation of such Code, where
no specific penalty is provided therefor, the violation of any such provision of this Code shall be punished
by a fine of not more than five hundred dollars ($500.00). Each day any violation of any provision of this
Code shall continue shall constitute a separate offense.
SECTION SEVEN : That in case of the amendment of any section of such Code for which a penalty is
not provided, the general penalty as provided in Section Six of this ordinance and Section 1.25 of such
Code shall apply to the section as amended or in case such amendment contains provisions for which a
penalty, other than the aforementioned general penalty is provided in another section in the same
chapter, the penalty so provided in such other section shall be held to relate to the section so amended,
unless such penalty is specifically repealed therein.
SECTION EIGHT : That it shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation in the Village to change or
amend by additions or deletions any part or portion of such Code, or to insert or delete pages or portions
thereof, or to alter or tamper with such Code in any manner whatsoever which will cause the law of the
Village of Deerfield to be misrepresented thereby. Any person, firm or corporation violating this Section
shall be punished as provided in Section 1.25 of the Municipal Code of the Village of Deerfield, Illinois.
SECTION NINE : That all ordinances or parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are, to the extent of such
conflict, hereby repealed.
SECTION TEN : That this ordinance and the Code adopted by same shall be in full force and effect from
and after its passage and approval in accordance with law, as printed and published in book form by
order of the President and Board of Trustees.
AYES: Blumenthal, Gavin, Marty, Seidman, Stiehr, Swanson (6) NAYS: None (0)
ABSENT: None (0)
PASSED this 7th day of September A.D., 1976.
APPROVED this 7th day of September A.D., 1976
PREFACE
This village code of the village of Deerfield, as supplemented, contains ordinances up to and including
ordinance 0-18-04, passed March 19,2018. Ordinances of the village adopted after said ordinance
supersede the provisions of this village code to the extent that they are in conflict or inconsistent
therewith. Consult the village office in order to ascertain whether any particular provision of the code has
been amended, superseded or repealed.
Sterling Codifiers
Coeur d'Alene, Id aho
CHAPTER 1. GENERAL PROVISIONS.
Sec. 1-1. Designation and citation of Code.
The ordinances embraced in the following Chapters and Sections shall constitute and be designated as
"The Municipal Code of the Village of Deerfield, Illinois, 1975", and may be so cited. The Code may also
6/5/2019 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 4/495
be cited as the "Municipal Code" or, in the provisions which follow, as "this Code". (M.C. 1963, §
29.101.)
Sec. 1-2. Definitions and rules of construction.
(a) In the construction of this Code and all ordinances the following rules of construction and definitions
shall be observed unless inconsistent with the manifest intent of the President and the Board or the
context clearly requires otherwise:
(1) And/or means and may be read or and or may be read and if the sense requires it.
(2) Board means the Board of Trustees of the Village of Deerfield.
(3) Bond means an obligation in writing, binding the signatory to pay a sum certain upon the
happening or failure of an event.
(4) Building means any structure intended to have walls and a roof.
(5) Business means any profession, trade, occupation and any other commercial enterprise
conducted for monetary reward.
(6) Clerk means the Village Clerk.
(7) Computation of time. The time within which an act is to be done shall be computed by excluding
the first but including the last day, and if the last day be a Saturday, Sunday or legal holiday, the time
runs until the end of the next day which is neither a Saturday, Sunday or legal holiday.
(8) County means the Counties of Cook and/or Lake.
(9) Dealer (Wholesaler and Retailer). Wholesaler relates to the sale of goods, merchandise, articles
or things in quantity to persons who purchase for the purpose of resale, as distinguished from a retail
dealer who sells in smaller quantities direct to the consumer.
(10) Definitions given within a Chapter or Article apply only to words or phrases used in such Chapter
or Article unless otherwise provided.
(11) Designee , following an official of the Village, means the authorized agent, employee or
representative of such official.
(12) Gender: Words used in any Section importing the masculine gender shall include the feminine
and neuter as well as the masculine.
(13) Governing Body means the Board of Trustees. By ordinance there is established the office of
Village Manager who is granted substantial powers of administration.
(14) Health Officer means the Health Officer having jurisdiction within the Village.
(15) Joint authority means the authority given to several persons or officers. Such authority vests in a
majority of such persons or officers.
(16) Keeper means one in possession of or who has the care, custody or superintendence of a thing,
place or business whether or not the owner or proprietor, and includes any person, firm, association,
corporation, club and co-partnership whether acting by themselves or by a servant, agent or
employee.
(17) May: The word may is permissive and discretionary.
6/5/2019 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 5/495
(18) Mayor means the Mayor of the Village who is the same person and may also be referred to as
the President of the Board of Trustees.
(19) Month means a calendar month unless otherwise expressed.
(20) Number: Words used in the singular include the plural and the plural includes the singular
number.
(21) Oath shall be construed to include an affirmation in all cases in which, by law, an affirmation may
be substituted for an oath and in such cases the words "swear" and "sworn" shall be equivalent to
the words "affirm" and "affirmed".
(22) Occupant means tenant or person in actual possession.
(23) Operate means carry on, keep, conduct, maintain, manage, direct or superintend.
(24) Ordinances mean the ordinances of the Village of Deerfield and all amendments and
supplements thereto.
(25) Owner means one who has complete dominion over particular property and who is the one in
whom legal or equitable title rests; when applied to a building or land, owner means any part owner,
joint owner, owner of a community or partnership interest, life tenant, tenant in common, joint tenant
or tenant by the entirety of the whole or part of such building or land.
(26) Person means any individual, natural person, joint stock company, partnership, voluntary
association, society, club, firm, company, corporation, business trust, organization, or any other
group acting as a unit, or the manager, lessee, agent, servant, partner, member, director, officer or
employee of any of them including an executor, administrator, trustee, receiver, or other
representative appointed according to law.
(27) Personal Property means any money, goods, movable chattels, things in action, evidence of
debt, all objects and rights which are capable of ownership, and every other species of property
except real property.
(28) Preceding and Following mean next before and next after, respectively.
(29) Property. The word property shall include real and personal property.
(30) Proprietor means an owner of the property or premises including any person, firm, association,
corporation, club, partnership or other group acting as a unit whether acting by themselves or by a
servant, agent or employee.
(31) Public place means any park, lake, stream, stadium, athletic field, playground, school yard,
street, boulevard, avenue, alley, plaza, square, bus, train, or railroad depot, station, terminal,
cemetery, open space adjacent thereto, all beaches, canals or other waterways, grounds and
buildings or any other place commonly open to the public.
(32) Real Property means land, together with all things attached to the land so as to become a part
thereof.
(33) Registered mail. The word registered mail shall include certified mail with return receipt
requested.
(34) Residence. The place adopted by a person as his habitation, and to which, whenever he is
absent, he has intention of returning. When a person eats at one place and sleeps at another, the
place where such person sleeps shall be deemed his residence.
6/5/2019 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 6/495
(35) Shall. The word shall is mandatory.
(36) Sidewalk. That portion of a street between the curb line and the adjacent property along the
margin of the street or other highway, designed, constructed and intended for the use of pedestrians
to the exclusion of vehicles.
(37) Signature and subscription. The name of a person mark or symbol appended by him to a writing
with intent to authenticate the instrument as one made or put into effect by him.
(38) State. The State of Illinois.
(39) Statutes or Compiled Statutes or S.H.A. The latest published edition of the Statutes or Compiled
Statutes or S.H.A. of Illinois.
(40) Street. Any public way, road, highway, street, court, avenue, boulevard, parkway, alley, lane,
viaduct and bridge.
(41) Tense. Words used in the past or present tense include the future as well as the past and
present.
(42) Village. The Village of Deerfield in the Counties of Cook and/or Lake, State of Illinois, except as
otherwise provided.
(43) Village Limits. Within the Village and includes not only the corporate limits of the Village, but also
any property which it owns or which is under its jurisdiction.
(44) Village President. The President of the Board of Trustees who also may be referred to as the
Mayor of the Village.
(45) Written or in writing. Shall be construed to include any representation of words, letters or figures
whether by printing, mimeographing or otherwise.
(46) Year. A calendar year, unless a contrary intention be expressed. (M.C. 1963, §§29.102, 29.103)
Sec. 1-3. Certified copy of Code admissible in evidence. 1
Any copy of the "Municipal Code of the Village of Deerfield, Illinois, 1975", or any copy of any addition,
amendment or supplement thereto, adopted, published and certified according to law shall be received
in evidence in all courts and administrative tribunals for the purpose of proving the ordinances therein
contained with like effect and for the same purpose as the original ordinances would be received.
Sec. 1-4. Acts by deputy or designee.
Whenever a power is granted to or a duty is imposed upon a public officer or employee, the power may
be performed by an authorized deputy or designee or by any person authorized pursuant to law or
ordinance, unless this Code expressly provides otherwise.
Sec. 1-5. Catchlines and headings; construction.
All designations and headings of chapters, articles, divisions and sections are intended only for
convenience in arrangement and as mere catchwords to indicate the contents of such chapters, articles,
divisions or sections, whether printed in boldface type or italics. They shall not be deemed or taken to be
any part of or title of such chapters, articles, divisions or sections; nor unless expressly so provided,
shall they be so deemed upon amendment or reenactment; nor shall they be construed to govern, limit,
6/5/2019 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 7/495
modify, alter or in any other manner affect the scope, meaning or intent of any of the provisions of this
Code.
Sec. 1-6. Interpretations of section numbers.
(a) Each section of this Code shall be numbered consecutively by chapter. The number shall consist of
two (2) component parts separated by a dash, the figure before the dash referring to the chapter
number and the figure after the dash referring to the position of the section within the chapter.
(b) The decimal system shall be used for all additions or amendments to this Code. When a chapter or
section is to be added the new chapter or section shall be given a decimal character.
Sec. 1-7. Code provisions as continuance of existing ordinances.
The provisions appearing in this Code, insofar as they relate to the same subject matter and are
substantially the same as those ordinance provisions previously adopted by the Village and existing at
the effective date of this Code, shall be considered as restatements and continuations thereof and not as
new enactments.
Sec. 1-8. References include amendments and penalties; construction.
(a) Any reference in this Code to an ordinance or provision of this Code shall mean such ordinance or
provision as may now exist or is hereafter amended.
(b) Any reference in this Code to chapters, articles, divisions or sections shall be to the chapters,
articles, divisions and sections of this Code unless otherwise specified.
(c) Any reference to any amendment of any section of this Code containing provisions for which a
penalty is provided in another section, the penalty so provided in such other section shall be held to
relate to this section so amended or the amending section whether reenacted in the amendatory
ordinance or not, unless such penalty is specifically repealed therein. (M.C. 1963, §§29.201, 29.202)
Sec. 1-9. Additions, amendments and supplements.
Any additions, amendments or supplements to this Code when passed in such form as to indicate the
intention of the President and the Board of Trustees to make them a part of this Code shall be deemed
to be incorporated in this Code so that a reference to the "The Municipal Code of the Village of
Deerfield, Illinois, 1975" shall be understood as including them.
(M.C. 1963, § 29.203.)
Sec. 1-10. Effect of repeal of ordinances; revival.
(a) Neither the adoption of this Code nor the repeal hereby of any ordinance of the Village shall in any
manner affect the prosecution for violation of ordinances, which violations were committed prior to
the effective date hereof, nor be construed as a waiver of any license or penalty at the effective date
due and unpaid under such ordinances, nor be construed as affecting any of the provisions of such
ordinance relating to the collection of any such license or penalty or the penal provisions applicable
to any violation thereof, nor to affect the validity of any bond or cash deposit in lieu thereof, required
to be posted, filed or deposited pursuant to any ordinance, and all rights and obligations thereof
appertaining shall continue in full force and effect.
6/5/2019 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 8/495
(b) Whenever any ordinance repealing a former ordinance, clause or provision, shall be itself repealed,
such repeal shall not be construed to revive such former ordinance, clause or provision, unless it
shall be therein so expressly provided.
Sec. 1-11. Same offense punishable by different Sections of the Code; Village's
option.
In all cases where the same offense is made punishable or is created by different Sections of this Code,
the Village may elect under which to proceed, but not more than one (1) recovery shall be had against
the same person for the same offense.
(M.C. 1963, § 29.104.)
Sec. 1-12. Conflicting provisions.
(a) If the provisions of different Chapters, Articles, Divisions or Section of this Code conflict with or
contravene each other, the provisions of each Chapter, Article, Division or Section shall prevail as to
all matters and questions growing out of the subject matter of that Chapter, Article, Division or
Section.
(b) If clearly conflicting provisions are found in different Sections of the same Chapter, the provisions of
the Section last enacted shall prevail unless the construction is inconsistent with the meaning of that
Chapter.
Sec. 1-13. Territorial applicability.
This Code shall refer only to the omission or commission of acts within the territorial limits of the Village
and to that territory outside the Village over which the Village has jurisdiction or control by virtue of any
Constitutional provisions or any law.
Sec. 1-14. Ordinances; time of taking effect.
All ordinances, passed by the President and Board of Trustees, requiring publication, shall take effect
after due publication thereof, as required by law, and ordinances relative thereto. Ordinances not
requiring publication, shall take effect from and after their passage and approval as provided by law,
unless otherwise provided therein. Ordinances requiring publication may be published in pamphlet form
by posting on the bulletin board in the Village Hall.
Sec. 1-15. Notices, reports, statements, applications and records to be written and
in English.
All notices, reports, statements, applications and records required or authorized by this Code shall be
made in writing in the English language, unless specifically provided otherwise.
Sec. 1-16. Notices; service and proof.
(a) Unless otherwise specifically provided, whenever a notice is required to be given pursuant to any
Section of this Code such notice shall be given either by personal delivery to the person to be notified
or by deposit in the United States Mail in a sealed envelope, postage prepaid, addressed to the
person to be notified at his last known business or residence address as the same appears in the
public records or other records pertaining to the matter for which such notice is served, or by any
6/5/2019 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 9/495
other method of delivery approved by law. Service by mail shall be deemed to have been completed
at the time of deposit in the post office or any United States mailbox.
(b) Proof of giving any notice may be made by the certificate of any officer or employee of the Village or
by affidavit of any person over the age of eighteen (18) years who actually accomplished personal
service in conformity with this Code or other provisions of law applicable to the subject matter
concerned, or by a return receipt signed by the recipient notified by United States Mail.
Sec. 1-17. Unlawful or prohibited acts include causing, permitting, concealing.
Whenever in this Code any act or omission is made unlawful or prohibited, it shall include causing,
allowing, permitting, aiding, abetting, suffering or concealing the fact of such act or omission.
Sec. 1-18. Reference To Official Plan:
Any reference to the official plan of the village shall be taken to mean and include all of the provisions of
section 2-14 of this code. (1963 Code § 10.502)
Sec. 1-19. Maps; Plats; Subdivisions; Requirements:
No map or plat of any subdivision presented for record affecting land within the corporate limits of the
village and in the territory contiguous thereto not more than one and one-half (1 1/2) miles distant, and
not included in any city, village or incorporated town, after the adoption of the official plan, shall be
entitled to record or shall be valid unless the subdivision thereon shown shall provide for streets, alleys
and public grounds in conformity with any requirements applicable thereto of such official plan See also
chapter 20 of this code, subdivisions generally.2. (1963 Code § 10.503; amd. Ord. 0-69-37)
Sec. 1-20. Corporate Seal:
The corporate seal of the village shall be as follows: A circular disk with the words "Village of Deerfield,
Deerfield, Illinois" in the periphery thereof; and the words "Corporate Seal" in the center thereof. (1963
Code § 10.601)
Sec. 1-21. Fiscal Year:
The fiscal year of the village shall begin on May 1 of each year and end on April 30, of the following
year; provided, however, that the fiscal year of the village beginning on May 1, 2013, shall end on
December 31, 2013.
Commencing January 1, 2014, the fiscal year of the village shall begin on January 1 of each year and
end on December 31 of the same year. (Ord. 0-13-1, 1-7-2013)
Sec. 1-22. Datum:
(a)The datum for the establishment of grades in the village is hereby established as the same as the
Chicago city datum as established by the trustees of the Illinois And Michigan Canal, in 1847, which
datum was measured from the plane of low water in Lake Michigan in that year.
(b)The standard elevation of the notch cut in the water table at the northwest corner of the three-story
brick building at the southwest corner of Deerfield and Waukegan Roads, shall be and is hereby
established at 112.496 feet above datum, which elevation shall be the bench from which all village
grades and benches shall be established. (1963 Code § 10.603)
6/5/2019 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 10/495
Sec. 1-23. Surety Bonds; Requirements:
(a)Whenever a surety bond to indemnify the village is required as a prerequisite to exercising the duties
of any office or position, or to the issuance of any license or permit or the exercise of any special
privilege, the surety on such bond shall be a corporation licensed and authorized to do business in
the state of Illinois as a surety company, in the absence of specific provision to the contrary by this
code or by ordinance.
(b)Whenever in its opinion additional sureties or an additional surety may be needed on any bond to
indemnify the village against any loss or liability because of the insolvency of the existing surety or
sureties or for any other reason, the board of trustees may order a new surety or sureties to be
secured for such bond. If such new surety or sureties are not procured within ten (10) days from the
time such order is transmitted to the principal on the bond, or his assignee, the board shall declare
the bond to be void, and thereupon such principal or his assignee, shall be deemed to have
surrendered such privilege, or position as a condition for which the bond was required. (1963 Code
§§ 10.605, 10.606)
Sec. 1-24. Severability Of Parts Of Code:
It is declared to be the intention of the board that the sections, subsections, paragraphs, sentences,
clauses and words of this code are severable. If any section, subsection, paragraph, sentence, clause or
word is declared unconstitutional or otherwise invalid by the lawful judgment or decree of any court of
competent jurisdiction, its unconstitutionality or invalidity shall not affect the validity of any of the
remaining sections, subsections, paragraphs, sentences, clauses and words of this code, since the
same would have been enacted by the board without and irrespective of any unconstitutional or
otherwise invalid section, subsection, paragraph, sentence, clause or word being incorporated into this
code. (1963 Code)
Sec. 1-25. General Penalty:
(a)In any case where there shall be a violation of any section of this code for which no specific penalty is
provided, the person violating that section shall be subject to a fine of not more than five hundred
dollars ($500.00).
(b)Each day any violation of any section of this code shall continue shall constitute a separate offense.
(c)The payment of such fine in installments by indigent persons shall be made as provided by law 3.
(d)Confinement for a term not exceeding six (6) months in the county jail or other place of legal
incarceration for each violation of any section of this code may be imposed when authorized by state
statute 4.
(e)Where the penalty for any particular offense is limited by state statute then such imitation shall be
applicable to the provisions of this code notwithstanding the provisions of this section.
(f)The suspension or revocation of any license, permit, certificate or other privilege imposed by the
village shall not be regarded as a penalty for the purposes of this code but shall be in addition
thereto. (M.C. 1963, § 29.104)
(g)Compliance tickets may be issued for violations of this code and zoning ordinance in accordance with
the provisions and procedures set forth in chapter 22 of this code and the zoning ordinance. (Ord. 0-
91-02, 2-4-1991)
6/5/2019 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 11/495
Sec. 1-26. Suspension Or Revocation Of Licenses Or Permits; Refusal To Issue
Licenses Or Permits:
(a)The village may refuse to issue a license or permit or the licenses or permits issued pursuant to this
code, unless otherwise provided in this code, may be suspended or revoked by the president or such
other authorized official, department, board or agency where applicable, after notice and hearing for
any of the following causes:
(1) Any fraud, misrepresentations or false statements contained in the application for permit or
license;
(2) Any fraud, misrepresentation or false statement made in connection with the selling of goods,
wares, merchandise and services; (M.C. 1963, §§ 29.301, 29.302, 29.303)
(3) Any violation of this code and/or any ordinance of the village; except that if said violation results
from the failure to make any required payments of any fees or charges to the village, the aforestated
requirement of notice and hearing prior to the refusal to issue a license or permit or to the revocation
thereof shall not be applicable; (Ord. 0-82-16, 3-1-1982)
(4) Conviction of the applicant, licensee or permittee of any crime or misdemeanor involving moral
turpitude or a violation of any act of the state, or any law of the United States having a reasonable
relationship to the purpose and scope of the permit or license;
(5) Conducting the activity under this code and/or any ordinance of the village in an unlawful manner
or in such a manner as to constitute a breach of the peace or to constitute a menace to the health,
safety, morals or general welfare of the public.
(b)Notice of hearing for the suspension or revocation of a license or permit shall be, in writing, given by
the clerk, setting forth specifically the grounds of the complaint and the time and place of the hearing.
Service of such notice shall be made by either personal service or by certified mail, return receipt
requested, to the applicant, licensee or permittee at the last known address, at least five (5) days
prior to the date set for the hearing.
(c)In case of refusal to issue a permit or license or the suspension or revocation of a license or permit as
herein provided, no portion of the application, license or permit fee shall be returned to the applicant,
licensee or permittee unless otherwise provided in this code and/or any ordinance of the village.
(d)Any suspension or revocation hereunder may be either in addition to or instead of any penalty or fine
as prescribed in this code and/or any ordinance of the village.
(e)The order of the president or such other authorized official, department, board or agency where
applicable, shall be the final municipal action for the purpose of judicial review.
Sec. 1-27. Printing And Distribution Of Code:
(a)This code shall be printed and published in loose leaf binder volume form so as to facilitate the
addition or removal of future ordinances and to serve as a convenient device for keeping this code
current.
(b)The president shall have the power to extend to or reciprocate the courtesies of other municipalities
by presenting to them a copy of this code at the expense of the village and he shall have the power
to present two (2) copies of this code to the Illinois municipal league. (M.C. 1963, §§ 29.301, 29.302,
29.303)
6/5/2019 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 12/495
Sec. 1-28. Ordinances; Publication; Record:
All ordinances, passed by the president and board of trustees, shall be recorded by the clerk in a book,
kept for village ordinances. The original shall be filed in the office of the clerk and due proof of
publication of all ordinances requiring publication shall be procured by the clerk, such proof or affidavit of
publication shall be attached to and filed away with such ordinances and the clerk shall also note on
such book of ordinances, at the foot of the record of each ordinance, a memorandum of the date of the
passage of and, if published or posted, the date of the publication or posting of such ordinance.
Sec. 1-29. Official Logo:
The village logo of the village of Deerfield, which consists of a deer on a field of green, a copy of which is
reproduced below, is hereby adopted as the official logo of the village of Deerfield, Illinois, for all
municipal purposes. The use of this logo for any private commercial purpose without prior approval by
the board of trustees of the village of Deerfield is hereby prohibited.
(Ord. 0-02-42, 10-7-2002)
Sec. 1-30. Alternative Citations And Fines For Miscellaneous Offenses:
(a)Citations: Whenever a person is accused of any offense hereinafter enumerated, the village, by its
duly authorized representative, police officer or code enforcement officer, is authorized to issue the
alleged offender a citation which may be settled and compromised by fines and payments as
provided herein in lieu of initiating a prosecution of the offense by the service of a summons, warrant,
notice to appear or other process requiring mandatory court appearance.
(b)Contents Of Citation: Citations issued pursuant to subsection (a) of this section shall contain
language:
(1) Advising the offender that he has violated a specific ordinance.
(2) Requesting the offender to make payment of an amount applicable to the alleged offense as set
forth in subsection (e) of this section as a settlement of the offense.
(3) Informing the offender that his failure to timely pay the applicable amount to settle the alleged
offense and, if applicable, to remove or correct the violation, will result in a complaint being filed in
the circuit court of the appropriate county charging him with such offense.
(c)Process Of Settlement: A person accused of an offense pursuant to a citation under this section may
settle and compromise the alleged offense by paying to the village the applicable settlement amount
shown in the payment schedule for offenses set forth in subsection (e) of this section in accordance
with the instructions set forth in the citation.
(d)Correcting The Violation: A person accused of an offense pursuant to a citation under this section
shall correct or remove the violation within twenty four (24) hours after issuance of the citation, or
within such other period of time as may be specified by the officer in the citation. Any failure to
correct the violation may result in the issuance of additional citations pursuant to this section, or the
service of a summons and complaint, warrant, notice to appear or other process requiring a
mandatory court appearance by the person accused of the offense.
(e)Payment Schedule: The offense described in any citation issued pursuant to this section may be
settled, compromised and paid in the respective amounts set forth in the following payment schedule.
Citations issued pursuant to this section may be compromised and settled for the compromise
amount if paid within the time specified in the citation. If the compromise amount is not paid within
6/5/2019 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 13/495
the time specified in the citation, the alleged offender may compromise and settle the citation by
payment of the late payment amount within twenty eight (28) days of the date of the citation.

CHAPTER 2. ADMINISTRATION.
Article 1. In General.
Sec. 2-1. Officers and employees; application of Article. 5
The provisions of this Article shall apply alike to all officers and employees of the Village, regardless of
the time of the creation of the office or the time of the appointment of the officer or employee.
(M.C. 1963, § 10.101.)
Sec. 2-2. Appointments of employees; removal or suspension.
(a) The Village Manager shall make all appointments of all employees; provided, that all officers of the
Village shall be appointed and may be removed from office as provided by Statute.
(b) All employees appointed by the Village Manager shall be subject to removal, suspension or other
disciplinary action by the Village Manager.
6/5/2019 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 15/495
(c) The Village Manager may delegate the power of appointment and removal of Village employees to
Department Heads provided that all appointments, removals or other disciplinary action by
Department Heads shall be subject to the approval of the Village Manager. (M.C. 1963, § 10.102.)
Sec. 2-3. Terms of office.
(a) Every appointive officer or employee of the Village shall hold such office or employment position for
an indefinite term unless it is otherwise provided by statute or ordinance.
(b) Employees shall be selected on the basis of demonstrated ability, experience and training and
without regard to political belief or affiliation and without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin
and ancestry and shall serve so long as their services are required, and they adequately perform
their duties.
(M.C. 1963, § 10.103.)
Sec. 2-4. Assignment of duties.
(a) The Village Manager shall have the power to assign to any appointive officer or employee any duty
which is not assigned by ordinance to any other specific officer; provided that this provision shall not
be construed to empower the Village Manager to assign such duties to the Village Attorney or Village
Treasurer.
(b) The President shall determine disputes or questions relating to the respective powers or duties of
officers appointed by the President and the Board.
(M.C. 1963, § 10.104.)
Sec. 2-5. Inspection of records.
All records kept by any officer or employee of the Village shall be open to inspection by the President or
any member of the Board at all reasonable times, whether or not such records are required to be kept by
statute or ordinance.
(M.C. 1963, § 10.105.)
Sec. 2-6. Disposition of money received by an officer or employee.
Each officer or employee of the Village who receives money for the Village shall at least once each
month turn over all money received by him in his official capacity to the Director of Finance or Village
Treasurer with a statement showing the source from which the same was received.
(M.C. 1963, § 10.106.)
Sec. 2-7. Oath required.
Every officer of the Village shall, before entering upon his duties, take the oath prescribed by statute.
(M.C. 1963, § 10.107.)
Sec. 2-8. Bond required of officer and employee.
6/5/2019 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/IL/Deerfield/index.htm 16/495
(a)Every officer and employee, if required by the Board or by statute, before entering the duties of his
office or position, shall give a bond in such amount as may be determined by the Board, and with
such sureties as it may approve, conditioned upon the faithful performance of the duties of his office
or position.
(b)The village shall pay the cost of such bonds as it may require of the employees or officers. (M.C.
1963, § 10.108)
Sec. 2-9. Salaries Of Officers And Employees:
(a)All officers and employees of the village whose positions have been classified shall receive such
salaries as shall be provided in the annual budget adopted by the board; provided, that all salary
increases or decreases shall be approved by the village manager.
(b)All officers of the village whose positions are ungraded shall receive such salaries as may be
provided, from time to time, by ordinance.
(c)No officer or employee receiving a salary from the village shall be entitled to retain any portion of any
fees collected by him in the performance of his duties as a municipal officer or employee in the
absence of a specific ordinance provision to that effect. Any such fees which are received shall be
turned over to the director of finance. (M.C. 1963, § 10.109)
Sec. 2-10. Conservators Of The Peace; Arrests 2:
The president and members of the board, the director of building and zoning, the fire marshal and
deputy fire marshals, as well as every member of the police department, are hereby declared to be
conservators of the peace by statute. (M.C. 1963, § 10.110)
Sec. 2-11. Termination Of Office; Delivering Books And Records:
Every officer of the village, upon the termination of his term of office, for any cause whatsoever, shall
deliver to his successor all books and records which may be the property of the village and if no
successor has been appointed within one week after the termination of the term of office such property
shall be delivered to the village manager. (M.C. 1963, § 10.111)
Sec. 2-12. Interfering With Officer Or Employee Prohibited:
It shall be unlawful to interfere with or hinder any officer or employee of the village while engaged in his
duties. (M.C. 1963, § 10.113)
Sec. 2-13. Municipal Retirement Fund 3:
All nonelected officers and employees of the village on the regular payroll, other than policemen subject
to the police pension law, are under the provisions of the Illinois municipal retirement act, and the
contributions and payroll deductions prescribed in the said act shall be made pursuant thereto. (M.C.
1963, § 10.114)
Sec. 2-14. Official Plan; Establishment:
The official plan of the village shall consist of the following:
